subhead: Anutin Charnvirakul, of the conservative Bhumjaithai party, became prime minister in September after his predecessor was removed from office by the court over an ethics violation.

title: Reddit files legal challenge to Australia's social media ban
subhead: The country became the first to ban young teens from social media accounts including TikTok, Youtube and Instagram. Reddit is challenging the ban, arguing that the vast majority of the site's vistors are adults and that it should not be required to carry out checks.

title: At the Grand Palais, a full house for Eva Jospin and Claire Tabouret
subhead: The Parisian institution is bringing together exhibitions by the two French artists, who share a common favored material.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

The actor and rape accusations behind Brigitte Macron's 'stupid bitches' remark
subhead: France's first lady made headlines with her comments about feminist activists who disrupted a performance of the comedian Ary Abittan. They were contesting the dropping of rape charges against him earlier this year. Le Monde reviewed the ruling and spoke to the plaintiff.

title: Russian asylum seekers expelled from US end up on Ukraine front
subhead: Amid surging anti-migrant sentiment in the US and growing ties between Moscow and Washington, 64 Russians were deported from Arizona. Upon arrival in Moscow, the men soon received military draft notices.

title: Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.
